intro: Semecarpus hirtiflorus, commonly known as the hairy-flowered chestnut, is a deciduous tree native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Sapindaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces hard, woody fruits that contain a single seed, typical of the genus Semecarpus. It thrives in moist, fertile soils and is often found in lowland forests. The tree is valued for its ornamental appearance and has some traditional uses in local medicine.
